snippet: The Academy's promo for the Oscars telecast pokes fun at the dust-up over ouster of Brett Ratner and Eddie Murphy and pays tribute, sort of, to "Transformers."
abstract: The Academy's promo for the Oscars telecast pokes fun at the dust-up over ouster of Brett Ratner and Eddie Murphy and pays tribute, sort of, to "Transformers."
lead_paragraph: The Academy's tagline for this year's Oscars is "Celebrate the movies in all of us," and with its first promo for the Feb. 26 show, to be broadcast on ABC, the movie they would most like to celebrate is "Transformers." Megan Fox and Josh Duhamel star in the spot, which pokes gentle fun at the dust-up over the ouster of Brett Ratner and Eddie Murphy as producer and host, and features cameos from William Fichtner (correctly cast as a version of the telecast's new producer, spiky-haired Brian Grazer), Robin Williams and others. To be fair, the promo, made with the imprimatur of FunnyOrDie, also has shades of "Mission: Impossible" and "The Princess Bride," at least in Mr. Crystal's hair and makeup (although he looks more like Carol Kane). If it's a sign of the kind of telecast we'll see next month, we can bet on highly referential, high-production-value montages and familiar humor.

headline.main: Megan Fox and Josh Duhamel, but No Optimus Prime
